definition.@value: A condition of the gastrointestinal system, caused by an infection with the gram-negative bacteria Escherichia coli. This condition is characterised by acute, watery diarrhoea due to toxins released from the bacteria. Transmission is by the faecal-oral route from ingestion of contaminated food, water, or fomites. Confirmation is by identification of the Escherichia coli in faecal sample.

longDefinition.@value: Escherichia coli infection caused by Enterotoxigenic E coli (ETEC) strains which produce special toxins which stimulate the lining of the intestines causing them to secrete excessive fluid, thus producing diarrhea.
